symptoms.name: Watery diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: Onset 6-24 hours after ingestion, resolves within 24 hours

symptoms.name: Abdominal cramps
symptoms.pattern: Onset 6-24 hours after ingestion, resolves within 24 hours

risk_factors: Consumption of large-batch cooked food held at unsafe temperatures (40°F-140°F)
Consumption of contaminated meat, poultry, soups, sauces (e.g., gravy)

required: Isolation of large numbers of C. perfringens from contaminated food or stool
supportive: Direct identification of enterotoxin in stool samples
